intro: Mercklinia, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Campanulaceae. It is characterized by its bell-shaped, often yellow or orange flowers that bloom in late summer. The plants typically have upright stems and are native to regions in southern Africa. Mercklinia species are often cultivated for their ornamental value due to their vibrant blooms and compact growth habit. They prefer well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade for optimal growth.
